DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the resistance to blood flow offered by the pulmonary vasculature, which is normally one sixth of Systemic Vascular Resistance.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The resistance to blood flow offered by the pulmonary vasculature, which is normally one sixth of SVR. The major determinant of PVR is pulmonary vessel constriction, most often caused by hypoxia and/or hypercardia. Prolonged elevated PVR can cause right heart failure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Property.preferredDefinition: The resistance to blood flow offered by the pulmonary vasculature, which is normally one sixth of SVR. The major determinant of PVR is pulmonary vessel constriction, most often caused by hypoxia and/or hypercardia. Prolonged elevated PVR can cause right heart failure.

Concepts.definition: The resistance to blood flow offered by the pulmonary vasculature, which is normally one sixth of SVR. The major determinant of PVR is pulmonary vessel constriction, most often caused by hypoxia and/or hypercarbia. Prolonged elevated PVR can cause right heart failure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
